title: Forget Boredom! 8 Exciting Tips to Spice Up a Long-Distance Relationship

steps.title: Don’t rely on just emails, texting, and voice calls.
steps.content: Don’t rely on just emails, texting, and voice calls. Being able to see each other even when you’re far apart can make a big difference in your level of intimacy. As much as possible, use video platforms to communicate so you can see one another and feel more connected. [1] X Research source Make sure you and your sweetheart both have the same video-calling software installed. Some popular options include Skype, FaceTime (for Apple devices), Google Duo, and Zoom.

steps.title: Your time together is precious, so make it quality time.
steps.content: Your time together is precious, so make it quality time. According to dating coach John Keegan, "It’s especially important to make sure that you’re meeting each other’s emotional needs when you're dating long distance." When you chat, avoid just making vague small talk. Instead, try to go a little deeper. [2] X Expert Source Moshe Ratson, MFT, PCC Marriage & Family Therapist Expert Interview. 7 August 2019. For instance, go into the details of anything important or exciting that happened during your day, and talk about how it made you feel. [3] X Research source If you’re not sure what to talk about, ice-breaker questions can help. For example, you might ask things like, “What’s your most precious memory?” or “What’s something you’ve always dreamed of doing?” [4] X Trustworthy Source Greater Good in Action An initiative by UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center promoting science-based practices for a meaningful life Go to source

steps.title: Finding common ground is important in any relationship.
steps.content: Finding common ground is important in any relationship. When you don’t have the intimacy of regular in-person interactions, it becomes even more important! Ask lots of questions and try to get a sense of what you’re both into. [5] X Expert Source Moshe Ratson, MFT, PCC Marriage & Family Therapist Expert Interview. 7 August 2019. Try to take a genuine interest in things they like that you’re not as familiar with, too. Dating coach John Keegan suggests "looking for things you can share or special ways to get them involved with your life, like a project for work or a school paper." For example, you could both read a book by a mutual favorite author and have a chat about it the next time you call each other. Or, try collaborating on a creative project, like a blog about a topic you both love.

steps.title: Make it as much like an in-person date as you can.
steps.content: Make it as much like an in-person date as you can. [6] X Expert Source Moshe Ratson, MFT, PCC Marriage & Family Therapist Expert Interview. 7 August 2019. Work out a specific time and decide what you want to do in advance. As a fun example, dating coach John Keegan suggests activities like "eating dinner, reading poetry, having deep conversations, and/or watching the same movie on Netflix together." You could also play online games together or sign up for an online class on a topic you’re both interested in.

steps.title: If something makes you think of your SO, don’t hesitate to send it.
steps.content: If something makes you think of your SO, don’t hesitate to send it. Dating coach John Keegan suggests "sending these messages throughout the day, whether it's a song, an inspirational quote, or a YouTube clip." You can also share your own pictures and videos. For instance, send them a selfie or a photo you just took of a beautiful sunset. Include a heartfelt message, like, “I really wish you were here to see this with me! <3”

steps.title: Including them in your daily routine can bring you closer together.
steps.content: Including them in your daily routine can bring you closer together. When two people live together or regularly see each other in person, it’s much easier to feel like you’re actually sharing a life. Make a conscious effort to help your SO feel more present in your life by talking to them about day-to-day things, like your work, school, or social interactions. [7] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 June 2021. In addition to just talking, look for other ways to let them share in your experiences, such as: Asking for their advice on work situations. Asking them to help you study or review for a test. Getting their feedback on personal projects you’re working on. Virtually including them in get-togethers with friends or family.

steps.title: Get creative and have fun!
steps.content: Get creative and have fun! Whether you’re sexting, getting steamy over the phone, or having a face-to-face encounter over video chat, sexual intimacy can play a huge role in keeping a long-distance relationship exciting. Talk to your partner about what they enjoy and how you can keep things spicy, even if you can’t get physical in person. [8] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 June 2021. For instance, you might both enjoy sharing a naughty fantasy, watching porn together online, doing a little virtual roleplay, or just talking about what you’d like to do with one another the next time you meet. Having virtual sex over video chat can be especially exciting and fun. Just make sure to use a secure platform with an encrypted connection, such as Signal, so there’s less danger of somebody else seeing what you’re doing. [9] X Research source

steps.title: If you can, plan regular meetups—even if it’s just once a month.
steps.content: If you can, plan regular meetups—even if it’s just once a month. [10] X Expert Source Moshe Ratson, MFT, PCC Marriage & Family Therapist Expert Interview. 7 August 2019. While a long-distance relationship can work if you’re both willing to put in the effort, going too long without seeing each other can be really frustrating. To keep things exciting and give you both something to look forward to, do your best to get together now and then. [11] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 June 2021. If you live really far apart, consider meeting halfway. For instance, if one of you lives in Pennsylvania and the other lives in California, you might meet up in Montana for a hiking adventure in the mountains.
